channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: European Union hits Apple and Meta with nearly $800 million in fines amid U.S. trade tensions
item.description: The European Union on Wednesday fined Apple and Meta hundreds of millions of euros each for breaching the bloc's digital competition laws.

item.title: Software giant SAP’s shares surge 10% after first-quarter profit beat
item.description: SAP announced Wednesday that its first-quarter operating profit had risen by 58% year-on-year to hit 2.5 billion euros ($2.9 billion).

item.title: European stocks rise; SAP shares jump after first-quarter profit jump amid economic uncertainty
item.description: European markets traded higher on Wednesday as global market sentiment rebounds.

item.title: BP shares jump 5% as activist investor Elliott discloses stake build
item.description: BP shares jumped on Wednesday after activist investor Elliott went public with a stake of more than 5% in the struggling British oil major.

item.title: Dow futures rally 700 points after Trump softens stance on Powell, China tariffs: Live updates
item.description: The 30-stock Dow jumped more than 1,100 points at its peak on Tuesday.

item.title: CNBC's The China Connection newsletter: U.S. regulatory scrutiny fans Chinese stock delisting fears
item.description: A comment from U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has reignited fears on Wall Street about a forced delisting of Chinese stocks from U.S. exchanges.

item.title: Tesla's Optimus humanoid robots hit by China's rare earth restrictions, says Musk
item.description: China had earlier imposed new export controls on seven rare earth elements and magnets used in everything from defense to energy to automotive technologies.

item.title: Tesla reports 20% drop in auto revenue as first-quarter results miss Wall Street estimates
item.description: Tesla's first-quarter earnings report lands as investors reckon with a steep slide in the company's stock price.

item.title: Hong Kong stocks lead gains in Asia on hopes of de-escalation in U.S.-China tensions
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump indicated that final tariffs on Chinese exports to the U.S. "won’t be anywhere near as high as 145%."

item.title: Trump says he has 'no intention' of firing Fed Chair Powell
item.description: Powell, whom Trump appointed Fed chair during his first term as president, has flatly stated that the president cannot remove him under the law.

item.title: How Takeda's CEO transformed the company into a global pharma powerhouse
item.description: Takeda Pharmaceuticals, Japan's largest drugmaker, has undergone a sweeping transformation under CEO Christophe Weber, emerging as one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies.

item.title: I became an AI prompt engineer after a layoff from Meta: Now I'm 'on the cutting edge of the newest tech obsession'
item.description: Job loss became a "springboard" for Kelly Daniel, now a prompt director at Lazarus AI who's excited to work "at the cutting edge of the newest tech obsession."

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Trump, Bessent and Musk give markets the reassurance they need
item.description: Markets are open-minded, and often react almost instantaneously to any positive changes.

item.title: European Central Bank’s Lagarde weighs in on Trump's criticism of Fed's Powell
item.description: The ECB last week cut interest rates by a further 25 basis points and warned of a "deteriorated" growth outlook linked to tariff tensions.

item.title: Register now: Applications open for the world's top fintech companies of 2025 list
item.description: For the third year in a row, CNBC is working with market research firm Statista to list the world's top financial technology companies.

item.title: IMF cuts 2025 growth forecast for major Asian economies, warns of global slowdown on trade worries
item.description: On a global basis, growth was lowered from 3.3% to 2.8% for the whole of 2025, with the IMF saying that tariffs were "a major negative shock to growth."

item.title: Tesla is ‘carefully’ working on its India entry amid tariff concerns, says CFO
item.description: Tesla is cautiously navigating an entry into India, CFO Vaibhav Taneja said in an earnings call, as the EV maker faces falling sales and tariff threats.

item.title: Singapore inflation stays at 4-year lows as city-state prepares for election
item.description: Headline inflation rate was unchanged from last month at 0.9%, while core inflation fell to 0.5% from 0.6%.

item.title: More travelers are using ‘buy now, pay later’ plans to pay for trips. Here's when it may make sense
item.description: The BNPL model — which allows buyers to pay in installments, sometimes with no interest or late fees — is gaining traction among young, cash-strapped travelers.

item.title: This ultimate global safe haven benefiting from the dollar’s downfall is up 11% this year
item.description: 'Capital preservation is the name of the global investment game right now,' DataTrek's co-founder said.

item.title: Dow jumps 1,000 points Tuesday to snap four-day string of losses: Live updates
item.description: Stocks rallied on hopes that U.S.-China trade tensions could ease soon, as investors recovered most of the steep declines suffered in the previous session.

item.title: China’s CATL claims to beat BYD's EV battery record with longer range on a 5-minute charge
item.description: China's CATL has announced a set of new incoming products, including a battery it claims has set a "new global record for superfast charging technology."

item.title: Here's what Elon Musk said about tariffs and their potential effect on Tesla
item.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk addressed the tariff issue on his company's earnings call on Tuesday, making it clear that President Trump is calling the shots.

item.title: As the dollar falters, the world’s central banks tread a tightrope — devalue their currency or not
item.description: Uncertainty about U.S. policymaking has led to the dollar index weakening more than 9% so far this year. Market watchers see further declines.

item.title: Dropshippers reel from Trump's tariff gut punch: 'Profit margins have now been slashed'
item.description: "At the moment, we're seeing about a 33% decrease in revenue," said e-commerce entrepreneur Kamil Sattar, in reaction to the U.S. tariffs on China.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Tesla, Enphase Energy, Oklo, Bristol Myers Squibb and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in extended trading.

item.title: Auto groups lobby Trump administration against parts tariffs in rare unified message
item.description: The group – representing franchised dealers, suppliers and nearly all major automakers – say the upcoming levies could jeopardize U.S. automotive production.

item.title: JPMorgan cautions most investors won't have the stomach to handle CoreWeave's volatility
item.description: The high degree of unpredictability for artificial intelligence cloud company CoreWeave won't be tolerated by many on Wall Street, according to JPMorgan.

item.title: Sam Altman steps down as Oklo board chair, freeing nuclear startup to work with more AI companies
item.description: Oklo says its microreactors, called Aurora, have smaller and simpler designs that will range from 15 megawatts to as much as 100 megawatts or more.

item.title: Bitcoin retakes $90,000 as investors see it as alternative to diving dollar and turbulent stocks
item.description: Bitcoin reclaimed the $90,000 level for the first time since March as investors jumped into the crypto for a second day amid turbulence in the stock market.
